meanings.definition: A very large amount or quantity.
meanings.sent1: The store had shiploads of toys for the holiday season.
meanings.sent2: The factory produced shiploads of goods to meet the demand.
meanings.sent3: I have a shipload of homework to finish before the weekend.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter filled the room like a shipload of joy.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was overflowing with shiploads of gold coins.

meanings.definition: To transport or carry in large quantities by ship.
meanings.sent1: The company will shiploads of cars to different countries.
meanings.sent2: They decided to shiploads of supplies to the remote island.
meanings.sent3: I will shipload these packages to our customers with care.
meanings.sent4: Her words seemed to shipload comfort to those in need.
meanings.sent5: The music festival will shipload fans from all over the world.
